public ref class ActiveDirectoryRoleFactory abstract sealed

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("The System.Workflow.* types are deprecated. Instead, please use the new types from System.Activities.*")

Docs.summary: A factory class for creating objects from Windows NT aliases, email addresses, and security identifiers (SIDs).

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!NOTE] > [!INCLUDE[DeprecatedContent](~/includes/deprecatedcontent-md.md)]
All methods in <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.ActiveDirectoryRoleFactory> are static and no instance needs to be created. The constructor is hidden.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly Property Configuration As ActiveDirectoryRoleFactoryConfiguration

Docs.summary: Gets the object that is associated with the .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.Configuration.ActiveDirectoryRoleFactoryConfiguration> object is used for changing the standard Active Directory schema properties that the <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.ActiveDirectoryRole> class uses.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class System.Workflow.Activities.ActiveDirectoryRole CreateFromAlias(string alias) cil managed
Public Shared Function CreateFromAlias (alias As String) As ActiveDirectoryRole

Docs.param: The alias string to create the .
Docs.summary: Creates an instance of using the specified Windows NT alias.
Docs.returns: An instance of that describes the specified Windows NT alias.

remarks.format: ## Remarks <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.ActiveDirectoryRole> is a concrete implementation of the <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.WorkflowRole> abstract class that is used to access Active Directory functionality. Typically, the Active Directory store is used for storing organizational information for personnel. The main purpose for the <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.ActiveDirectoryRole> is for making queries against such organizational information for business reasons.
